intro: Astragalus feinbruniae, commonly known as the Feinbrun's milkvetch, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of Israel and the Palestinian territories. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its small, yellowish flowers and compound leaves. The plant is adapted to survive in harsh, dry environments, often growing in rocky or sandy soils. It plays a role in stabilizing soil and supporting local biodiversity in its native habitat. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and vulnerable species.
